subject: p19016834
History: Persistent cough in a patient with recent pneumonia.
Findings: PA and lateral upright chest radiographs were reviewed in comparison to. Current study demonstrates persistent right lower lobe consolidation with right infrahilar opacity and small amount of pleural effusion. No evidence of cavitation is demonstrated. Left lung is clear. Given the persistence of the abnormality, chest CT might be considered to exclude the possibility of post-obstructive infectious process.
